dataset.name: provenance
dataset.description: Version incremented from 0.8 (Provenance) to 1.1 (Provenance) in January 2023 following internal review and updates, and to match the versioning on the PRSB website.

concept.name: event_record
concept.description: This is a record of an event performed by someone or something. An event can happen at one time and be recorded at another time.

concept.name: author
concept.description: The person, professional or device recording the information in the record.

concept.name: person
concept.description: The person recording the information in the record.

concept.name: name
concept.description: The name of the person completing the record.

concept.name: relationship
concept.description: The relationship the personal contact has to the person, e.g. father, grandmother, family friend etc. Includes additional roles the person performs on behalf of the other (e.g. carer, next of kin, emergency contact, dependent, etc.).

concept.name: coded_value
concept.implementationGuidance:
PRSB strongly recommend using FHIR standards when implementing our standards as the agreed transport mechanism.

FHIR valueset 'UKCorePersonRelationshipType' : -  https://simplifier.net/hl7fhirukcorer4/ukcore-personrelationshiptype-110
concept.description: The coded value for relationship.
concept.valueSets: Nationally or internationally maintained code system(s) (see implementation guidance).

concept.name: free_text
concept.implementationGuidance: Relationships may be customised by users. Where no alignment is available to standardised lists, users may add to the list of relationships.
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available.

concept.name: professional
concept.description: The professional recording the information in the record.

concept.name: name
concept.description: The name of the professional.<br clear="none"/>

concept.name: role
concept.description: The role the professional has in relation to the person e.g. GP, physiotherapist, community nurse, social worker etc.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.implementationGuidance:
Alignment to the workforce dataset NHS Occupation codes primarily is advised. Where no code is available, free text may be used. Where no alignment is available to standardised lists, users may add to the roles:

National Workforce Data Set (NWD) NHS Occupation codes : - https://digital.nhs.uk/data-and-information/data-collections-and-data-sets/data-sets/national-workforce-data-set-nwd-and-nhs-occupation-codes 

Other nationally maintained lists include:

FHIR valueset 'UKCorePractitionerRoleCode' : - https://simplifier.net/HL7FHIRUKCoreR4/UKCore-PractitionerRoleCode

SNOMED CT concepts from FHIR R4 : -  << 223366009 | Healthcare professional (occupation) |  Descendant or self of concept. SNOMED codes are searchable through the browser tool here.
concept.description: The coded value for role.
concept.valueSets: Nationally or internationally maintained code system(s). E.g. HL7 FHIR Practitioner/Role; SNOMED; National workforce dataset; NHS Occupation codes. See implementation guidance.

concept.name: free_text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available.

concept.name: grade
concept.implementationGuidance: Please note that the ‘grade’ field may not be applicable in some settings and so does not need to be included in the implementation where it does not apply (e.g. social care settings).
concept.description: The grade of the professional.

concept.name: specialty
concept.description: The specialty of the professional e.g. physiotherapy, oncology, mental health, etc.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.implementationGuidance:
The ‘Main Specialty Codes’ in Table 1 of the NHS Data Dictionary code list for specialties is advised.

NHS data dictionary 'Main Specialty and Treatment Function Codes Table': https://www.datadictionary.nhs.uk/supporting_information/main_specialty_and_treatment_function_codes_table.html
concept.description: The coded value for specialty.
concept.valueSets: Nationally or internationally mandated code system(s) (see implementation guidance).

concept.name: free_text
concept.implementationGuidance: The PRSB suggests users use generic specialties to suit the customer base where applicable, which should align with nationally identified specialties that are coded (or will be in future). Specialties may be customised by users. Where no alignment is available to standardised lists, users may add to the list of specialties.
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available.

concept.name: professional_identifier_type
concept.implementationGuidance:
PRSB suggest users use generic professional identifier types to suit the customer base where applicable, which should align with nationally identified professional identifier types that are coded (or will be in future).

Professional identifier types may be customised by users. Where no alignment is available to standardised lists, users may add to the list of professional identifier types. 

NHS Data Dictionary 'Professional Registration Body Code' : https://www.datadictionary.nhs.uk/attributes/professional_registration_body_code.html
concept.description: The type of professional identifier. For example, General Medical Council (GMC); Nursing and Midwifery Council (NMC) numbers.
concept.valueSets: Nationally or internationally maintained code system(s) (see implementation guidance).

concept.name: professional_identifier
concept.implementationGuidance: This field is to record the actual professional identifier (NHS; NMC, HCPC etc).
concept.description: Professional identifier for the professional completing the record e.g. General Medical Council (GMC), Nursing Medical Council (NMC) number etc, or the personal identifier used by the local organisation.

concept.name: organisation
concept.description: The name of the organisation the professional works for.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.implementationGuidance:
Use of NHS data dictionary Organisation Data Service (ODS) codes is advised:

https://www.datadictionary.nhs.uk/supporting_information/organisation_data_service.html#:~:text=Description-,The%20Organisation%20Data%20Service%20(ODS)%20is%20provided%20by%20NHS%20Digital,Social%20Care%20Organisation%20Reference%20Data

Guidance around how to locate ODS codes can be found at: https://www.digitalsocialcare.co.uk/latest-guidance/how-to-find-your-ods-code/#:~:text=An%20ODS%20code%20(also%20called,Data%20Security%20and%20Protection%20Toolkit.

Users should use the NHS Digital ODS portal to locate specific ODS codes. See: https://odsportal.digital.nhs.uk/Organisation/Search
concept.description: The coded value for organisation.
concept.valueSets: Nationally or internationally maintained code list(s) (see implementation guidance).

concept.name: free_text
concept.implementationGuidance: The free text field should be used for any organisations not present in the coded list. For example, many social care organisations may not be coded.
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: device
concept.description: The device recording the information in the record.

concept.name: device_type
concept.description: The device type.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.implementationGuidance: As of December 2022, PRSB recommend aligning to SNOMED CT or dm+d codes.
concept.description: The coded value for device type.
concept.valueSets: Nationally or internationally maintained code system(s) (see implementation guidance).

concept.name: free_text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available.

concept.name: device_manufacturer
concept.description: Name of the device manufacturer.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.implementationGuidance: As of December 2022, PRSB recommend aligning to SNOMED CT or dm+d codes.
concept.description: The coded value for device manufacturer.
concept.valueSets: Nationally or internationally maintained code system(s) (see implementation guidance).

concept.name: free_text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: model
concept.description: The model of the device.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.implementationGuidance: As of December 2022, PRSB recommend aligning to SNOMED CT or dm+d codes.
concept.description: The coded value for model.
concept.valueSets: Nationally or internationally maintained code system(s) (see implementation guidance)

concept.name: free_text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: software_version
concept.description: The version of software running on the device.

concept.name: unique_identifier
concept.description: The unique identifier for the device.

concept.name: activity_location
concept.description: The location where the activity was performed.

concept.name: activity_location_type
concept.implementationGuidance:
As of November 2022, the NHS Data Dictionary Activity Location Type code (see https://www.datadictionary.nhs.uk/attributes/activity_location_type_code.html) should be used where possible (or its equivalent in other countries). For example Scotland may have alternative codes (see https://www.ndc.scot.nhs.uk/Data-Dictionary/).

Use X01 for ‘other locations not elsewhere classified’

Where an ‘activity location’ is not available in the list, it should be recorded under the free text field under ‘activity location’.
concept.description: The type of location where the activity took place.
concept.valueSets: Nationally or internationally maintained code system(s) (see implementation guidance).

concept.name: activity_location
concept.description: The location where the activity took place.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.implementationGuidance:
As of November 2022 use of NHS data dictionary Organisation Data Service (ODS) codes is advised. 
 
NHS data dictionary 'Organisation Data Service' : - https://www.datadictionary.nhs.uk/supporting_information/organisation_data_service.html#:~:text=Description-,The%20Organisation%20Data%20Service%20(ODS)%20is%20provided%20by%20NHS%20Digital,Social%20Care%20Organisation%20Reference%20Data
 
Information on ODS codes can be found on the NHS Digital website (see https://digital.nhs.uk/services/organisation-data-service). The ‘Access our data’ section includes file downloads including code lists, a portal to search for ODS codes and an Application Programming Interface (API) suite.
 
Additional guidance for social care suppliers and providers around how to use ODS codes is available (see https://www.digitalsocialcare.co.uk/latest-guidance/how-to-find-your-ods-code/#:~:text=An%20ODS%20code%20(also%20called,Data%20Security%20and%20Protection%20Toolkit). 
 
Activity locations should be recorded as precisely as possible, and at the most granular level available (eg ‘ward’).

Some examples can be found below for different ways ‘Activity location’ and ‘activity location type’ may be recorded:

Example 1: Point of Care Testing (POCT) result on inpatient ward

Activity location type:

  • Coded Value: E02 = ward (or blank)

Activity Location:

  • Coded value: RAP04 = Ward T8 at North Middlesex Hospital
  • Free text: <blank>

Example 2: as above (but no ward code under ‘activity location’)

Activity location type:

  • Coded Value: E02 = ward

Activity location

  • Coded value: RAPNM = North Middlesex Hospital
  • Free text: Ward T4, side room

Example 3: Insulin being administered at home

Activity location type:

  • Coded Value: A01 = Patient’s home

Activity location

  • Coded value: <blank>
  • Free text: <blank>

Example 4: Insulin being administered at care home with nursing

Activity location type:

  • Coded Value: G02 = Care home with nursing

Activity location:

  • Coded value: <blank> (no code)
  • Free text: Daisy care home, Ealing Broadway, X11; Y12
concept.description: The coded value for activity location.
concept.valueSets: Nationally or internationally maintained code system(s) (see implementation guidance).

concept.name: free_text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: event_date
concept.description: Date of the event.

concept.name: date_recorded
concept.description: Date the event was recorded.
